title: Dont smash Kalista's face in with a Nerf Bat. Break her Knees.
body:
90% ad on basic attacks is just stupid on so many levels.
For fucks sake guys, CLARITY. If you must do that, just have it reduce her total AD by 10%, then up her ratios to compensate.

However, I would like you to stay away from % damage reduction built into basic attacks. It is just irritating.

Do any of these things (but for fucks sake, no ALL of them)
-Nerf her base health to 498 from 518
-Nerf her attack range to 535 from 550 (She has SO much mobility, she should have to get close-ish to hit you. You would have to up her movespeed from Anivia levels if you did that though)
-Nerf her base attack speed to 0.600 from 0.658
-Change the mana cost on E to 80, and have the mana refund per unit kill be 30, so that she is always losing mana when she casts it
-Remove the Slow on E
-Nerf the Ratio per spear to 30% BONUS ad from 30% total
-Nerf the %hp damage on sentinel
-Lower her Q's AD ratio to 90% AD

See?
There are SO MANY ways you can nerf kalista WITHOUT Olafing her (Which is def what this does. It is the disadvantage Yasuo has on his crits, except if Kalista crits, it is doubled, since Kalista's reduced damage is done before the crit)
edit: holy shit that's a lot of people

replies.body: I fucking love this post, not only do I agree that she needs a nerf, but what the fuck Riot don't pull a Yasuo on Kalista. 90% of AD. Are you going to do this with every mechanically broken champion so you can keep LCS plays?

I don't see how you compare Yasuo to Kalista, they both are overpowered but for different reasons. Yasuo is just overloaded, either you're going to go up against that project skin Yasuo who wind walls in the opposite direction and goes 0-20, or you're going against someone who understands his kit and goes 20-0. Kalista is overpowered for a different reason, she's overpowered by her entire concept I think. The entire design was a flaw to begin with. She has infinite mobility that allows her to outscale every ADC in the game due to her Rend, and on top of that she has two forms of hard CC. I'm not sure many people realize it but I also think Kalista's sentinel passive lets her and her support do 20% of a target's health on auto attack when they attack that same target. Yasuo and Kalista are both quite unbalanced despite the community's myth a guy with like 10 different passives, an ability that invalidates all projectiles in the game, infinite dashes through any enemy/neutral units, and 100% crit chance at 15 minutes into the game is just oh so weak and how dare Riot EVER give him a real skill base. But anyways, they're unbalanced for very different reasons.

I think a big reason Yasuo tends to be feast-or-famine is because his double crit steroid is a huge snowball mechanic that's much stronger when you're doing well and have more crit than when you're behind and have less.  

Kalista is just as overloaded as Yasuo, and the parallels between the two are easy to draw (both CertainlyT champs, so that's not surprising).  Both have heaps of mobility, steroids to inflate their damage, and utility spells that would seem more fitting on a support kit.

With Yasuo a good player will definitely try to get ahead in kills and then basically outscale everyone else in the game since he already had 100% crit chance pretty early on with most standard builds I think and if not he will just abuse the fact you can be blind and stupid and still get 400 CS by the end of a 35 minute game with Yasuo and still sort of outscale everyone else in a similar way.

I don't think people are right for defending Yasuo, nor really any CertainlyT champions. The designer has proven totally incompetent to actually make good, balanced champions and I would be totally fine if every champion made by him with the exception of Zyra was nerfed. Zyra is a really handicapped mid laner (I just got Level 4 with her so I have fair experience with her mid.) and probably the only champion CertainlyT ever made that is underpowered. HOWEVER, she was probably one of the most overpowered champions on release. She had more damage, lower cooldowns, larger range, more damage, more damage, more damage and basically it was harder to lose with her than to win with her.
Well, Zyra wasn't really a CertainlyT champion.  Skribbles started her design, then CertainlyT joined and worked with Xyph/Morello/Coronach on it.

Interestingly, Zyra's kit was considered to be "incredibly overloaded" when she was released. That's why she has a revenge passive. They consider it "free power", since it's only useful when behind (and even then, still a bit weak).

Sadly, It seems CertainlyT misinterpreted that lesson. :/

Yea, and look at Zyra's kit through the lens of today - it hardly seems overloaded compared to recent releases.  Hell, the only thing in her kit that even looks like a CertainlyT mechanic to me is her ult's interaction with her plants.  Everything else is fairly straightforward, and she gives up a spell in order to get plants, so the complaints about her plants need to be taken with a grain of salt.
Wellllppppp, prepare to get downvoted to oblivion by the "CertainlyT is the best designer to exist and all of his champions are balanced" bandwagon fanboys.

Eh, I'm used to it by now.

Too hard for people to consider the game as a whole instead of their personal experience.  All the focus on how it feels to play the champ or how novel their signature skill is rather than how it feels to play _against_ the champ or whether that signature skill belongs on a different role.

In fairness, there are not many champions that most people don't hate the very thought of, CertainlyT champions or otherwise, so even that thought has less weight than you would think it should. Take Nasus mains for example. It feels great to get that mid-game powerspike and snowball from there, but to the enemy he feels like a bullshit champion that you can barely push out of lane and have to babysit for the entire game. Then you've got Lux mains who enjoy her laning supremacy, picking power and mid-game teamfight dominance, and yet to the enemy it feels like a champion you can barely approach without risk of being blown up from so far away you can't properly react. Then you have the poster-boy for "balanced" and "healthy" in this game right now: Vel'koz. His mains love his controlling playstyle and early-mid-game team eradication capability, and his detractors hate that a good Vel'koz can make you feel literally helpless against him, especially if you're melee. 

Playing against a champion will rarely ever feel fun in the hands of a competent player, just like if you're doing well with a champion everyone will hate your champion. So play Fizz, or LeBlanc, or Yasuo, or whatever, because, well, they're here and they won't be going anywhere. All we can do now is balance them because discussing whether or not their signature move would be more apropos elsewhere, well, it's only discussion after the fact because the action that permanently determined that move's fate was already made. Reworks can only accomplish so much, and if they're used too much they'll simply be viewed as a balancing crutch - and you should never have to rely on a crutch when you're perfectly capable of walking unaided.

This is not to say I like or support CertainlyT's champions, because I friggin' hate them. But how it feels to play against a champion doesn't count for as much as you'd hope in a competitive game.

OK, I'm not trying to say that if a champion is EVER complained about, that it's an indicator of whether they're healthy for the game.  However, in all of the examples you listed, I can point to real weaknesses and real counterplay that leaves players who get beaten by that champion feeling like they can do something better to win the next time around.  CertainlyT champions are very bad in that regard.  For Lux, you dodge her skillshots.  For Nasus, you force him to teamfight & then kite him.  For Velkoz, you dodge his skillshot & even if you didn't dodge the first, you dodge the subsequent ones to avoid taking damage from his passive.    

For Kalista?  You're near-forced to take a point-and-click CC, you're prevented from trying to contest a smite without killing the enemy team, you're at a ridiculous disadvantage if your team is immobile, etc.  The game you lose to Kalista as a fed Udyr or fed similar champion, you don't feel like there was anything you could've done short of choosing a different champ.  The game you lose to Yasuo feels just as helpless if you're a champion with power invested in projectiles (perhaps even your ultimate) and Yasuo just negates it with a non-ult spell.  But even that still feels like you had a chance if you timed it differently - the rest of Yasuo's kit is what feels worse.  The stupid mobility, the long range engage, the steroids... there's playing against someone and not enjoying it because you're on the losing end, and then there's playing against someone and not enjoying it regardless of which end you're on.  The latter was why Yorick got nerfed into oblivion, and it's why I despise Yasuo.  Darius is equally unhealthy for a lot of top lane melee matchups.  

There's a reason people make this claim of CertainlyT champions and not of the rest.  Very few people complained about new Sion being unfun to play against, very few complained about new Ashe, very few complained about Velkoz or Braum.  I could get into the differences, but that's been beaten to death elsewhere.

Wait, there are other people on the "We hate CertainlyT's champion designs" boat?

Can I like, hate Darius (No interesting gameplay mechanics) and Thresh (could deal 0 damage and still be almost viable) also?

I dislike Kalista.
I dislike her very much.

Even though this nerf makes me smile, I'd agree on your proposed nerfs. They seem more though trough.
dont hate her too much. save your hate for the teemo{{champion:17}}

I hate kalista but my problem with her is not solely her mobility.

I hate her E be cause it's {{champion:29}} 's Expunge but way stronger, and it can be used to take the dragon way too easily.

I hate here as a character, because she's Shadow Island {{champion:110}} . Just the same thing as Varus. They're all guilty and I'm the Vengeance! UGH!

{{champion:429}} WE are vengeance!

So how does that work?

Kalista is the collective embodiment of all the betrayed souls she made a pact with. The army general who originally was Kalista is but one of those souls, and each new pact causes her to lose what little individuality she has left. Of course, you wouldn't know all this because Kalista's in-game personality has all the depth and expressivity of a bird bath.

no offense "kalista main" but she will be closer to being actually balanced then the way she currently is.

its funny that you bring olaf in the mix who has it in his job description to slaughter adc seeing as he is a bruiser but CANNOT touch kalista. 

news flash he will stil be unable to really touch a half decent kalista.
kalista's kit is broken simple as that her rend and passive need to be switched period then you can start balancing her like give her martial poise charges or something.

No, she won't. This will only nerf her already weak late game. She'll still scale stupidly well with a rushed BF Sword, which is a problem they explicitly noted as a reason for making these changes. Yet they have done nothing about it.

I also don't recall anyone saying anything about being a Kalista main. Funny how you just assume anyone opposed to this totally hamfisted nerf must be abusing her strengths to win games. The reality is that these changes don't hit her where she is inappropriately strong, and therefore are NOT balanced.

Her passive...is a passive. And Rend has an active effect that is crucial to its function. You have to be able to push the button, or Rend does nothing. You CAN'T switch them. That's absurd.

News flash: even with these changes, she will STILL spank Olaf. So will Vayne. So will Caitlyn, and Tristana. This isn't because they're OP. It's because Olaf is trash. In fact, he's rather infamous for having been rendered such. Hence the people saying "don't Olaf her".

Thing is though, Rend is only a problem due to its free smite ability to take drag/baron, and is extremely frustrating having it outscale YOUR smite as a jungler, and not allowing you to make a steal on baron/dragon. The only other champion I have been able to do more damage on a monster without smite other than kalista has been Full AP Cho'Gath, which isn't that bad, but his ult can only scale to about 400-500 bonus true damage on his ult, whereas Kalista can just keep on chucking spears at her target scaling over 1500 damage, AFTER resistances.

And Olaf isn't trash. I haven't played any single game with any champion which I have not been able to contribute to my team in some way. Olaf is moreso a counter champion vs people like Nasus and Riven, to deny farm and snowballing. Although, Vayne, Caitlyn, and Tristana also are affected by Undertow's Slow, which allows Olaf to be able to catch up to them and beat their faces in, whereas kalista has the passive in which undertow can't do shet, and his recent buff only lasts one second, where he can't really catch up to a quarter-decent kalista.

Okay, but Kalista can't STEAL dragon with Rend. She can only secure it, and only if she stays attacking it the whole time. If you're the jungler, and Kalista is determined to Rend dragon, kill her first. If she tries to fight you, she either loses all her stacks on dragon, or she tries to sneak in attacks on it to keep her stacks and ends up getting attacked by both it and you. Compare this to jungle Nidalee being able to toss a 700+ damage javelin just before smiting for the steal (or jungle Cho, for that matter). Not much you can do about that.

My dream Kalista changelist:

* **Allow her dashes to be affected by crowd control: stuns, roots and suppresses should interrupt her dashes, and slows should slow them down (though she'd still be able to attack mid-dash if that happens)**. _Kalista is effectively immune to slows while in combat right now, and can dash while under the effects of most hard CC, which I find particularly egregious considering she's already good at dodging most CC-laden abilities. This is also why I feel she's super-unpleasant to deal with as a melee champion, because what crowd control melees rely on to stick to her just doesn't work well most of the time._
* **Remove the Black Spear's stun/death animation, and allow its targets to refuse the pact. **_The fact that the Black Spear's pact is unconsensual deeply irritates me, and its death pact thing even more so, as I think it brings little flavor and instead, at best, delays an ally, and at worst stuns them at a really inappropriate time. I guess it might be bad for an ally to refuse the pact and cause Kalista to try again, but even so, if nobody wants to bond to Kalista there are deeper issues at hand than her personal loss in power._
* **Remove Kalista's global soundbites when making a pact or calling back her Oathsworn ally with Fate's Call.** _Many Rioters on the effects teams constantly mention how global visual or sound effects occupy space and make it more difficult to add more of those, because too many would clutter the game and call unnecessary attention. Neither Kalista's pact nor her ultimate are relevant enough to warrant global sound effects, in my opinion, as neither carry any immediate global threat. I'm also fairly salty that she gets to have global effects when {{champion:30}} can't even do the same when casting his ult, which already carries global visuals and sound._
* **Remove Sentinel's mana cost, make the sentinels' movement speed scale with Kalista's, and increase the number of laps they can perform per rank, as well as the ability's maximum range.** _Let's be honest, mana is never a real gate to Kalista's W active, nor does that ability need to be gated by anything other than its long recharge time. I feel like Kalista's sentinels are fairly underused overall, too, and deserve to be activated more readily for target-hunting and objective guarding. Utility is also a facet of Kalista I feel is heavily underdeveloped, and buffing her unique vision contribution would allow her to shine in a unique way without stepping too hard on other champions' toes._
* **Remove Rend's slow and mana restoration and cap its damage versus monsters, but reduce its mana cost to 40 / 35 / 30 / 25 / 20 and add an indicator over targets that will be killed upon activating Rend.** _As an ability that is made specifically to execute targets, Rend absolutely does not need a slow, which I feel is redundant in many ways: she doesn't need more kill potential on an ability that is itself designed to secure kills, and whose success is meant to be a hard yes (target's dead, Rend refreshes) or no (target's alive, Rend goes on cooldown), and she doesn't need more sticking or kiting power when she has on-demand infinite dashes. I dislike its unlimited damage against monsters because it allows her to out-{{summoner:11}} junglers and exert far too much control over objectives, and I dislike the mana restoration because it's mostly a not-too-visible bonus effect designed to let her clear waves more easily, when a simple mana cost reduction per rank would do just as well. I'd rather she had more power placed into stuff like her extended damage, unique utility or Oathsworn interaction than extraneous effects like these._
* **Reduce Rend's initial damage (to something like 20 / 25 / 30 / 35 / 40 (+ 40% AD), for example), but have Kalista's Oathsworn ally apply spears with every basic attack, and have each additional spear deal the same damage as the first.** _Kalista's interaction with her Oathsworn often feels downplayed outside of her ult, and I feel it would make sense for her ally to contribute to her damage by participating in extended trades with her. I also think smoothing out her damage would shift her poking power (which isn't too big a thing on her) towards her Q, which also feels a bit redundant in her kit, and would allow her to work even better with attack speed builds overall._

Who's on board with this?
You've convinced me man.

Thank you! I completely agree with your post, too: as unpleasant as Kalista may be, I think reducing her autoattacking power via a nerf to her AA scalings is ugly and clunky, and would likely just make her feel less satisfying to play while still being just as frustrating to deal with. In general, I feel her kit is fairly bloated as is with conditionals and variables that add little depth to her gameplay, and really want to streamline her kit (perhaps a bit too much) rather than pile on even more unique passives, even if they're maluses (she, {{champion:157}} and {{champion:412}} are the only champions I know who have had universal mechanics expressly _nerfed_ on them, along with perhaps post-rework {{champion:22}} and her inability to crit on her first basic attack).

Slows affecting her passive: No. Martial Poise already leaves you tethered to your enemies. If she's not in attack range, she has to walk, and she's incredibly slow. The entire point is that she has great mobility as long as she stays in combat. It's kind of reverse Boots of Mobility. Slows are to chase or to escape. If she's using her passive, the combat has already started. Stuns and roots are to lock someone down or disengage. I keep getting this feeling that people want a melee champion with no gap closers and no stuns to be able to chase her down and unload all their damage on her, and...that's just not reasonable.

Yes, Rend needs a slow, for the same reason its mana cost refund can be triggered more than once per cast. It's meant to be stacked on multiple targets, and is expected to only kill some of them. Furthermore, if Rend doesn't get the kill immediately, Kalista has no means to re-engage without that slow, AND she loses a large chunk of her damage in the near future. Every other ADC has some form of crowd control, and most also have a target-independent dash that they can use from outside their attack range. Kalista can kite and move about only while still in combat. She has no other means of engaging unless her support is around to answer Fate's Call.

As for damage against monsters, objective control is a significant part of her identity in terms of mechanics (the other being unrivaled kiting ability), but she still has to work for it. In order for her to really "out-smite smite", she needs to have been committed to attacking dragon/baron for a significant stretch of time. If you let her have that much access to objectives without challenging her, you don't deserve to reliably just walk up and steal them with smite (and also you're not doing your job as a jungler). **A summoner spell is not a substitute for playing the game.** There are dashes that arguably outperform Flash on a shorter cooldown, too, and a few champions who can easily out-heal a Heal spell or out-shield a barrier, or cleanse themselves frequently. And she's not the only champion who, given proper setup, is able to deal a large chunk of damage with a single move. Cho'Gath eats dragons for a snack between teamfights, and his "better than smite" move needs no setup time at all. So many people keep complaining that she can secure dragon if you let her sit there and attack it for 20 seconds, and I am just baffled as to why anyone would let her do that, and expect her NOT to get the dragon, or think it's unfair that she does. **Kalista does not steal dragon or baron. She has to earn it.**

Making Rend work like Braum's passive would be horrifyingly oppressive and un-fun to play against, even if you didn't boost the damage per additional spear. Please, no. It would be so much extra damage. D: Don't let her build Rend stacks without actually attacking. Please, please no.

Overall, I'm just not feeling this. Trim her attack range, maybe. Reduce the scaling on Rend, and make crits grant extra stacks. Take some of the damage out of Pierce, and give it back plus a little more only against targets with Rend stacks (since you're supposed to kill them with Pierce to transfer the stacks, but how often does that happen?). Pull some levers here and there, but don't strip out the things that make playing her what it is.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
>
> I keep getting this feeling that people want a melee champion with no gap closers and no stuns to be able to chase her down and unload all their damage on her, and...that's just not reasonable.

Because clearly, it would be ludicrous for a champion like {{champion:2}} or {{champion:68}} to so much as try to fight her. That wouldn't be reasonable at all.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
> 
> Yes, Rend needs a slow, for the same reason its mana cost refund can be triggered more than once per cast. It's meant to be stacked on multiple targets, and is expected to only kill some of them.

I feel like the whole multiple-stacking scenario only makes sense in the context of wave clear. Outside of it, bar screwy {{item:3085}} shenanigans, Kalista's only going to be focusing one target at a time.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
>
> Furthermore, if Rend doesn't get the kill immediately, Kalista has no means to re-engage without that slow, AND she loses a large chunk of her damage in the near future.

Well that would suck. If only she had a means to close the gap between her and her target...

My point is, Rend is meant to have a clear success and fail case, and Kalista doesn't need padding to that ability to make sure she wins even when she fails to execute her target. I would rather give Rend a kill indicator to facilitate executions than give her CC she doesn't need.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
>
> Every other ADC has some form of crowd control, and most also have a target-independent dash that they can use from outside their attack range. Kalista can kite and move about only while still in combat. She has no other means of engaging unless her support is around to answer Fate's Call.

Every other ADC doesn't have a perma-dash, though, so that point is moot, and Kalista already has a free-targeted dash in the form of her Q, as well as a knockup with her ult. I also feel making her completely independent of her Oathsworn ally, when she has this whole set of mechanics that put power into interaction with them, sort of defeats the point, and makes her weaknesses less meaningful. Sure, Kalista would be weak without her Oathsworn, but that's sort of the point, and part of her identity as an ally-dependent marksman.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
> 
> **A summoner spell is not a substitute for playing the game.** 

That's not what I'm saying. {{summoner:11}} is critical to a jungler's identity, far more than Kalista's objective securing potential (which I think can be argued to be more circumstantial to her identity than her kiting power or ally-mancing), and its power is what allows junglers to make clutch steals or secures. Kalista completely invalidates that with Rend, and effectively guarantees that her team will secure an objective if allowed to sit on it for long enough, which completely goes against the idea of clutch steals. Junglers have to earn their objectives too, and even other effects like Cho's ult or {{champion:20}}'s Consume don't invalidate smite steals in the same way. If Kalista's picked only for her ability to sit on Dragon/Baron and guarantee its capture, then I think she'd need a new identity.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
> 
> Making Rend work like Braum's passive would be horrifyingly oppressive and un-fun to play against, even if you didn't boost the damage per additional spear.

Why? It would only add more interaction between her and her Oathsworn ally, which is a good thing. There is nothing oppressive in focusing targets as a team, and I feel her ability to out-smite junglers and auto-win against certain champions, both of which you defended, is an order of magnitude more oppressive than this could ever be, particularly since an effect like this could be balanced with number tweaks.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=00140001,timestamp=2015-07-04T03:22:28.701+0000)
> 
> Pull some levers here and there, but don't strip out the things that make playing her what it is.

Kalista's identity is that of a master kiter who trades off a lot of personal power in exchange for supremely awesome synergy with a specific partner, and I think the changes I'm proposing would only strengthen that identity. If the only things that make her worth playing are mechanics that aren't fun to have around, then I would rather strip those away completely and give her a new identity. Thankfully, she still has a really interesting playstyle, and has a lot of contributions to make even without her total objective control or under-the-hood CC resistance, so that would likely not be necessary.

**"Because clearly, it would be ludicrous for a champion like {{champion:2}} or {{champion:68}} to so much as try to fight her. That wouldn't be reasonable at all."**

Alone? If she didn't start top lane, and she's built as an ADC with decent attack speed? I'd say no, it wouldn't be. It's not actually their job. And BEFORE she's got that attack speed, if she's their lane opponent? Well, that's a different story. I'd say go for it. If she rushes attack speed, she won't actually be able to hurt them much, and they can poke and farm. If she goes damage, she's squishy, and they can kill her. She needs both before she can fight them. If she has both, yeah, they're screwed. But it's not unheard of for one champion to be considered another's counter, or for people to start roaming because they lost their lane and don't want to feed.

**"bar screwy {{item:3085}} shenanigans"**

DON'T bar them. That's considered a core item for her, for EXACTLY this reason.

**"CC she doesn't need."**

Like I said, she does need it. Her mobility is bound to her being in combat, and as soon as she's not, she loses it. Her movespeed is very slow when she's walking.

**"Kalista already has a free-targeted dash in the form of her Q"**

Which has a windup and short dash range that makes it almost useless for chasing if the target is already out of range and running away.

**"effectively guarantees that her team will secure an objective if allowed to sit on it for long enough"**

...Then don't let her sit on objectives. Duh. You should be creating sufficient map pressure that sitting on dragon seems like a bad idea. As for clutch steals, they're still possible. Not really any more difficult than if your opponents have double smite. The issue is that you have to respect her ability to secure objectives, and actually deal with her. And maybe you think only another jungler â only another summoner running smite â should be able to demand that kind of respect around the dragon or baron, but I don't. Being able to walk in and press a single button at the right time (a button that's unrelated to your champion, which literally anyone can press if they choose, regardless of their role) and call that a clutch play is honestly just sad. If you let her sit on dragon too long, then you need to stop her. That's fair.

**"There is nothing oppressive in focusing targets as a team,"**

Kalista can stack Rend on multiple targets. She already has the synergy thing with her W passive, and that ALREADY lets her casually chunk the health of both lane opponents with alarming regularity. If her support could also stack Rend on champions while she farms (or preps minions to reset Rend and immediately begin that process again), she'd never lose her lane. Ever.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=0014000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-04T05:37:29.840+0000)
>
>  But it's not unheard of for one champion to be considered another's counter, or for people to start roaming because they lost their lane and don't want to feed.

There is a difference between a counter and a hard counter. {{champion:67}} counters {{champion:36}} because she's really good at whittling down his health and dodging his cleavers, but he still has plenty of different opportunities to approach her and kill her, or run away from her. Kalista, by contrast, offers no real opportunities for many champions to fight back against her, and consequently combat against her feels extremely lopsided. It often feels like you're just spectating her as she pings you down from out of range and eventually executes you, and that's not fun. The fact that she also partially or totally invalidates many kinds of crowd control for no good reason is also not a good thing.

> [{quoted}](name=SoMNia,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=5zmjygbq,comment-id=0014000100000000,timestamp=2015-07-04T05:37:29.840+0000)
> 
> DON'T bar them. That's considered a core item for her, for EXACTLY this reason.
